title: Advise and tips for applying jobs offcampus
content:
Can anybody who was bagged an offcampus offer this year or in the previous years guide me how you guys managed to do it?.

I'm 2023 grad with avg cgpa and avg profile with no job offer in hand.
This combined with the recession is making it extremely difficult to get a interview callback.

Any suggestions from guys who have done it would be highly appreciated 🙏.

Also any tips on how to get referrals?

comments.body: Would you mind telling me your cgpa... I'm in the same boat currently... Is ur cgpa the reason you didn't get an offer oncampus

7.84.

>Is ur cgpa the reason you didn't get an offer oncampus

No I did miss a whole lot of companies but I still could have landed a decent job. But I fked up.
So I'm your junior(sem 5) with a 7.5 cgpa... But my resume is pretty strong... You think the cgpa could be a losing factor for my placements?? Im extremely worried about this
So I'm your junior(sem 5) with a 7.5 cgpa... But my resume is pretty strong... You think the cgpa could be a losing factor for my placements?? Im extremely worried about this
Atleast for me that's the case, I was not eligible for so many good companies as my cgpa was less than 7.5 during placement

Atleast in pes... Yes... When there r so many people... Even if u have a good resume... The first factor the college or the company will use to filter out students is obviously cgpa... And then they'll check resumes. So ya, please dont ignore ur cgpa here
Is having above 7.5 a safe bet how many companies will I lose out on compared to an 8 pointer

7.5+ is pretty safe... But if there r a lot of ppl with 8+ then u will obviously miss out... So no matter what don't let it fall below 7.5..keep trying to do better.... 6th is basically the last sem with 20+ credits... So score well in 6th sem.

>... You think the cgpa could be a losing factor for my placements

It depends you can still get a excellent package.

But you will miss few good companies like AMD, Walmart,Arista networks etc .

>Is having above 7.5 a safe bet how many companies will I lose out on compared to an 8 pointer... I have done 3 internships, founded a startup

If u have startup why need to attend placement?
